result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Arnold Meixner Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Arnold Meixner Jr.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth Arnold Meixner Jr.
Current: 372 West Main Street #5, Ellsworth, WI 54011 United States  (Effective: 11-01-2016)
Prior: W7595 650th Ave, Beldenville, WI 54003 United States

02:32 Defendant Kenneth Arnold Meixner in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: plead to count, sentence to time served. Court reviews waiver or right to an attorney with the defendant on the record. Defendant wishes to proceed by representing himself.  Court finds that defendant freely, intelligently, voluntarily and knowingly waives his right to an attorney. Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the defendant on the record.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY. Court will use facts in the criminal complaint to support conviction, defendant states that facts in criminal complaint are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty.  Court orders defendant to time served. Appeal rights given to defendant. 02:42

to Withdraw from Representation filed by Atty Nelson
Plea hearing on June 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 3, 2016 at 11:45 am.

3:48 Defendant Kenneth Arnold Meixner in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties.r  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. THorie: $1000 signature bond. Nelson: no objection. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Def has not been in the armed services. Qualifies for the PD  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 11:45 am.
